1.Text:
Shangri-La Frontier, a full-dive VR game often
referred to as god-tier. Today three friends are
having another lively session within its world...
And...there! One more left!
It's headed your way, Sunraku! Take it down!
Yup, I'm on it!
Come on, let's make this easy!
...Okay, guess that's that. Good work, you two!

Higher-level monsters sure are great for farming XP.
I'm gaining levels like crazy.

Good, it's about time you stood on your own two feet.
I can't babysit sit lowbies forever, you know.

And just whose fault is it that I lost levels to
begin with, hmm?!

Huh... Hey, check your drops, guys. Did you get
anything weird?
Anything weird? Let me take a look...

Oh, you mean this? What the... It looks like a VR
headset.

Yup, that's it. Are they saying we should do VR in
VR?
No telling unless we try. Okay, Sunraku, put it on.

Hey, don't just assume I'll be the lab rat.
I'll give it a go, though.
...Well?
...Whoa. Is this some kinda unique ev—
—ent?!
Wha...! He warped?!
Hey, Pencilgon! Did Sunraku just say—

...He did. A unique event. So what's it going to
be, Katzo?

Like you even need to ask. We can't let him hog all
the fun!
Damn straight! Now, come on! Let's go catch him!
Whoa... Where are we?
It looks...like an ordinary town.

...Oh, you guys came, too. Not sure that's a good
thing, though...
Aha, the event hog himself! This time I'm gonna—

Hate to burst your bubble, but that's not what's
going on here. Or maybe I should say, we got bigger
things to worry about.

Notice that there's no map or anything displayed
here? And as for logging out...
Oh dear, looks like I can't.
Ugh, for real?! Should we contact the admins?

Can't imagine the SLF team missing such a rudimentary
bug... Maybe this is part of plot?

Anyhoo, we're not getting anywhere like this. Let's
go chat up some NPCs and see what's up.
Meanwhile, in another world—
...So these are the artifacts you were talking about?
Yes. Zeta found three of them.
Interesting...
(Yup, these are definitely VR headsets...)

I surmise...that this part goes over the eyes. It may
be connected to...the virtual space created by
Laugus... I'm still studying the details...

(A link to a virtual space...?! Never thought the VR
rigs in this world would be such amazing gadgets!)

(What if using these plunges me into a game,
a cryptic contest of life and death?!)

(Man, artifacts rock! They're like a dream come true
for boys and girls everywhere!)
So...should we try using them?

Keep your distance, Cid. There's no telling what
might happen.

(So that's your play, huh... Very slick, Alpha, very
slick. You always find ways to leave me out of the
fun!)

So if these do take the wearer to some unknown place,
which of us has the highest chance of survival if
something happens?
Well...you, of course.

Heh, then there's nothing to fear. I volunteer myself
to gaze into the abyss.
Cid...
I'll see you on the other side... Now, here goes.
...He put it on.
So? Do you feel any different?
Um, Master...? Hello?
...He's unconscious.
Wh-What...?

...You wait here, Eta. I'm going to report to the
rest of the Seven Shadows and discuss a solution!
Please be safe, Cid...

I...don't recognize this forest. Not that I was ever
any good at telling forests apart to begin with,
though.

I thought this was gonna be VR, but it looks so real
that it's kind of a buzzkill...

Sure would be nice to see something besides trees...
Hm?

A suit of armor...or should I say, samurai armor?
Things are getting Japanese all of a sudden.

But I can dig it! I love subculture-y stuff that
slaps different settings together!

This thing's pretty rusty, but maybe it'd move if I
fed it some magic...

...Hmm, nothing. And here I thought it'd be cool to
have an armor-clad minion tagging along.
Ah, whatever. More importantly—

...I'm starving. Didn't realize hunger would still be
a thing in VR.

Guess I'll start walking and see if I can find
anywhere to get something to eat.

2.Text: —And that sums up the situation.

How strange... I know he said would be back, but this
is worrying.

Our lord is in trouble, and we're here doing
nothing... Lady Alpha, is there no way we can go
find him?!
Calm down, Epsilon...

Two artifacts remain. If we use them, we may be able
to save Master Shadow. But—

He's the only one who knows what's on the other
side... It will be...undoubtedly dangerous...
So what're we gonna do?!

We all want to help Cid, so...let's decide who goes,
in a fair manner.
Yes...with Seven Shadows rock, paper, scissors!
I'll call it out. Is everyone ready?
Seven Shadows rock, paper, scissors! One, two—
Three!!!
...Looks like we have our two volunteers.

Lady Alpha and Delta... Please, bring Master Shadow
back!

Hmm... This gives me time...to figure out those
artifacts...

Well, there's not much else we can do. Please rest
assured we'll look after things here.

Yes, thank you, everyone. We will be back with Cid,
I promise.
See ya in a jiffy!

So this is the virtual space... It seems to be an
ordinary town. Delta, can you pick up anything?
*sniff sniff* I don't smell Boss man!

Which I suppose means...he hasn't come here yet.
Still, it would be foolish to act blindly.

Delta, let's start by gathering information on our
surroundings. We need to be aware so that—
Hey, do you have a second?
Um...pardon me?

Whoa, talk about NPCs with detailed models. I can see
the devs got really into making those black suits.

Cut it out, man. The AI in SLF is super good, so
talking like that might piss 'em off!

(A bird's head on a human body... It could be a rare
breed of therianthrope, or just some weirdo. Either
way, we should remain on guard...)
Huh? She's giving me some serious stink-eye.
See, I told ya so.

The birdy can talk?! Kinda weird, but I'm gonna catch
it anyway!

Ack! Wait, wait! We aren't bad guys, and feather-head
here is just a creep, not a monster. Don't worry!
Hey!

Anyway, we don't pose any danger to you. We only want
to talk, okay?

...Understood. Perhaps you'll answer our questions in
return?

Of course. Sounds like we have a deal, then. But
would you mind calming down your friend here?
Stay, Delta.
O-Okay!

Pro communicators are something else. She got us into
the dialogue phase, just like that.
Yeah, but I got labeled a creep in the process!

Whew, what a relief. Now we can finally get some info
about this place from the locals.

...Locals? But we're...never mind. We'll explain
that, too.

I see... And those artifacts are what brought you
here...
Sounds kinda like what happened to us, huh?

On the point of similar objects bringing us here,
yes.

Okay, so we know that this is someone's virtual space
and not a game. Now, how do we get out?
Whaaat?! We can't go home?!

Calm yourself. Laugus will surely have built in some
means of exit. We'll keep an eye out for clues as we
search for Cid.

Hey, how about we join forces? We'll help you look
for this Cid person, and you tell us if you find a
way out of this world.

I'd also like it we could pool our efforts while
we're stuck here. We'll lend a hand in any battles,
too. Well? I don't think it's a bad offer.

(The Shadow Garden in me says to avoid getting
involved with others, but...I don't think we have any
other choice, given the circumstances.)
Very well. Let's cooperate however we can.
Alright, it's a deal! Thanks, um...
Alpha.
And I'm Delta!

Alpha and Delta, got it! I'm Pencilgon! And here with
me are Stooge No. 1 and Stooge No. 2!

Wrong! I'm Sunraku, not a stooge, and definitely not
a creep!
I'm OiKatzo, and I'm no stooge either.
A bird and a male that's like a female.
Say, Alpha... Is your friend here okay?
What'd you say?! I hate people who say catty stuff!
Didn't take long for this relationship to go sour...
...Yes, it doesn't bode well.

3.Text:
While Alpha and the others meet, Cid strolls the
streets, having no way of knowing that there are
other visitors aside from himself.

(Hmm, this place is plain as can be... I was hoping
for something more obvious, like, I dunno, a city in
the grip of a heinous villain or something...)

(But this place being normal means more fun for me as
a shadowbroker! Not to mention that it's the perfect
setting to blend in as a side character.)

(I just know some daring heroes are gonna come along
soon enough to face off against the great evils in
this world...)

(And when they do, it's on! I'll give everyone in
this place a taste of shadowbroker showmanship!)
Hey, can I ask you something...

(Heh, knowing how to respond like you're nobody
special is the first part of being a shadowbroker.
Now observe the answer of a true side character!)
Wh-What is it? If I can help, then I—
...Huh?

Do you know anything about this world? Names of
places or any other little details will do.
Uh... Anyone home?

(G-Get it together. He came on so strong that my
brain shut down for a sec.)

(But come on, no shirt with a bird mask? Isn't that a
little too out there?)

(Wait...maybe that's his character type. Yeah,
like he's the party's token weirdo! Except those guys
usually end up being pretty strong!)

(Which means...this isn't an ideal situation. I need
to keep interactions with the heroes to minimum. So—)
Um, hello? No need to think about it that hard...
I-I don't know. Nope, I don't know a thing!
Wha? O-Oh, really...
Yup, really. So...be careful out there, traveler.
Uh, sure, thanks...

What the heck was up with that NPC? Not sure if he
was being nice or trying to brush me off...

(Whew, that was close. But run-ins with the main
cast are always high-risk.)

(My goal is to be a shadowbroker in side character's
clothing. That means interfering with protagonists
is a no—)

Hey, do you live here? I got a few questions for you,
okay?
S-Sure... Hm?

(...This one looks like a girl, but totally moves
and talks like a man.)

(The so-called femboy role, eh... Yep, you find them
in main character parties pretty often, too.)

(That said, it's not a great topic to bring up. There
may be some compelling reason behind them being the
way they are.)

(Be friendly but don't get too close—it's the best
way to deal with a complicated heart.)

While I'd love to be of help, I'm afraid I really
don't know much...

Hmm, gotcha... Not like an NPC would know how to get
outta here anyway.
...NPC?

Oh, uh, sorry. Just talking to myself! Thanks anyway,
see you—
Wait!

Many troubles may lie ahead for you, but...I'm on
your side.
O-Oh, okay. Thanks...

(Virtual spaces really are something else. Seems like
they even come with quirky characters straight out of
a video game.)

(But getting called an NPC... Does that mean I'm
pulling off my side character act almost too well?!)

(Yeah, that's a great milestone! Makes me feel like
I've reached a new level of nobody-ness!)

Hello there, sir. Do you have a moment? There's a few
things I'd like you to tell me, if you could...

(Huh? I sure am popular today. Guess I can scratch
what I just said, since I've obviously got work to
do. Anyway, time layer it on thick!)
...Urk!
Whoa, what's that reaction? Shocked by my beauty?

(I thought those other two were bad...but she just
might be the worst!)

(A smiling face with major serial killer vibes!
I'm sensing fathomless darkness here!)

My friends and I have been asking around for info,
but haven't been able to learn anything worthwhile.

(But I'm also detecting Gamma-level intellect...
Could she be the ringleader?)

(If so...then maybe now's a good time to drop a hint
of my existence. A little foreshadowing that this
unassuming extra was actually a shadowbroker all
along!)

So, one who seeks to escape this enclosed world has
arisen...
...Come again?

However, that time is not yet upon us. I shall be
observing you...from the shadows.
...He's gone.
Yo, Pencilgon!
Learn anything useful?

Well...I spoke to an NPC, but all I got out of him
was a bunch of edgy nonsense. Beats me what he was on
about.

I tried talking to a NPC, too, but he gave me the
cold shoulder... What'd I do wrong?

It's gotta be how you look. My NPC was super nice to
me, even though he didn't tell me anything.

Being judged by my appearance over here too...
I just can't catch a break.
Your situation aside, some NPCs are just weird.

While it's disappointing that we couldn't get
anything out of the townsfolk, maybe Alpha and
Delta had better luck.

I suppose we should catch up with them and hope
that's the case.

4.Text:
Hey there, Alpha. Hope the investigation went well.
Shall we share our findings?
...Would you mind going first?

Sure, no problem. Except, we weren't able to turn up
anything about this "Cid" guy you're after.
I see...

Apart from that, apparently the currency of this
world is called "zeni". Needless to say, we've never
heard of it.

They use the same currency where Delta and I are
from. But in our rush to get here, we neglected to
bring any with us.
Speaking of, where is Delta?

I sent her to find food, thinking we might be forced
to camp for a while. Sadly, it seems I was right.

Ugh, camping? Can't say I'm looking forward to it.
I'm an indoor type.

*sigh* A tough situation, but I suppose there's not
much we can do about it. So, is that all you have to
report, Alpha?

No, there's more. It's about these "levels" and
"stats" you mentioned.

It appears these concepts don't exist here. No matter
how many monsters we slew, there were no "experience
points" to be found.

Which means it's all about player skill. Hehe, now
this I like!
I get that, but what about the skills we used in SLF?
That's not something I would know, is it?
T-True enough...

In that case, shall we conduct a few tests in the
forest while we set up camp?

That will likely tell us whether we can use our
skills or not, and I'd like to check our damage
output without levels or stats.
Agreed! You in, Alpha?

Yes. Now that we're working together, your safety is
my responsibility.

Then it's decided. Tests...and hunting for tonight's
dinner! Let's go!

Boar, rabbit, and wild herbs... That ought to make a
decent enough meal.

Hold on, Sunraku. Aren't you forgetting why we came
here in the first place?

Good work, you three. Nice moves back there. So those
techniques you used occasionally... Were those your
"skills"?

Yup, very observant of you. Looks like we can still
use them here.

Although they're a little tough to use since we
can't see our recast times or HP changes... But,
that's where experience and instinct come into play.

Right. It's better than not being able to use them at
all, and that's enough.

Now that we've figured that out, maybe we should
start making camp—

...Wait, we came here without telling Delta. Do you
think she'll be okay?

Yes, no need to worry about her. In fact, she should
be back soon—
BOSS MAN!!!

See? For a nose as keen as hers, tracking my scent is
a simple matter—
...Wait, did you just say "boss man"?
I did! But...where is he?
What'd I tell ya? She's no good.
What'd you say?! I am very good!

But I smelled metal and heard it too, so maybe my
nose isn't working right...

I have faith in your senses, Delta. It's possible
that we encountered him without knowing it.
Does that ring a bell to anyone?

Hmm, let's see... I did talk to this one NPC with
black hair that gave me the cold shoulder.
Could that be...?!

But this guy seemed pretty weak—not at all like you
described. Just really average.
Hmm... That's not much to go on.
This one NPC that spoke to me was nice enough.
Boss man is definitely nice!

He felt kinda ordinary to me, though... More weak
than anything, I guess.
Then that's not Boss man.
I met someone with a bad case of edginess, but he—
He was ill? Cid is the very picture of health.

No, that's not what I mean... He said something
cryptic about watching from the shadows—
Shadows...?!

Black hair, soft-spoken, and says cryptic things...
That has to be Cid! Let's go find him at once!
Yes, ma'am!
...Man, this Cid guy really gets her engine revving.
Not surprising. Alpha is a girl, after all.
Is that why? Anyway, should we go after them?

5.Text:
(...Hmm. This town is really...plain. So plain that I can't
think of any other word for it.)

(And so far, that bird guy, the femboy, and that
sketchy lady are the only people who stand out.)

(Heh... Sounds like a pretty good place to live as a
background character, huh?)

(All I need to do now is stick to the shadows and
look for a way out, occasionally assisted by those
main characters, but never getting too close...)

(There it is! The ultimate solution to this place...
the ultimate side character life!)
BOSS MAN!!!
Hm? That sounds like... Nah, no way Delta's here.

Hey, he really was that NPC from before!
You should've said something sooner!

Anyways, we're gonna be working together from
now on, so nice to meet ya!

Wow, you certainly did pull of the "nobody important"
act well... Oh, but I don't mean that in a bad way.
...Explain.

Forgive me, Cid. I enlisted their help to get us out
of this situation.

Still, I'm truly glad to see you unharmed. Please
don't do anything else reckless.
...Oh really. Huh.
(It's over... Goodbye, perfect side character life!)
Now if we can cut this heartwarming reunion short...
(My heart isn't even a degree warmer.)

I'd like to go over the details one more time.
Have you noticed anything strange?

Hmm, not really. That goes for the town, too.
The very picture of mundane.

You're asking the wrong question. Of course he's
gonna say there wasn't anything weird.

Tell us everything from the start—what you've done
since getting here, what you saw...

Well, I put on the artifact...and then next thing I
knew, I was in the forest. There was this rusty old
armored warrior, and then—

S-Stop right there! I just heard a very important
word!
Wait a sec, by "armored warrior", do you mean...?!
...Wethermon the Tombguard.

Wait, but we defeated him, right? I REALLY hope this
is a case of mistaken identity.
You seem to have some connection to this "Wethermon".

Connection... Yeah, I guess you could say that. He's
a monster the three of us took out together.

That reminds me, Delta, didn't you say you smelled
and heard something metallic in the forest?
Yeah! Maybe it's the guy you're talking about?
Yeah. But why on earth would he be here...?

We beat Wethermon, no questioning that. So this one
may be unused or leftover data...basically not the
original.

(Smelling him is one thing, but if Delta heard him,
would that mean he's moving around? He was completely
immobile, last I saw.)
Anyway, that's not our question to answer. But—

He, Wethermon, might be the key to getting home. As
hardcore gamers, we gotta check it out.

*sigh* Just like a unique event. So our initial
reason for coming here was correct.

I'm not sure I understand everything, but can I
assume beating that armored guy is our ticket home?

You say that like it's gonna be easy. Us winning a
rematch against that thing is pretty laughable, okay?

Yeah, because we barely won the first time, and at
a massive cost to us all three of us.

So it was only the three of you. Wouldn't that mean
our chances are better this time around?
I mean, there are six of us—
Five of us. And I'm sure we'll be fine.

(Hold up... Uh, Alpha? You aren't trying to leave me
out of the action again, are you?)

You demonstrated your strength to us earlier. If
Delta and I join you, I'm fairly certain we can
overcome even the toughest of foes.

I could do it by myself! So you just stay back,
female male guy!
Hmph, well, somebody's got a mouth...
...We'll be fine, Cid. No need to trouble yourself.
(I knew it! She's trying to exclude me!)

But yeah, if you can't move that well, you'll only
get insta-killed. So, it looks like it's just going
be the five of us.
...Is that what you really think?
About what?
Do you really think it's going to be five on one?!
...Oh yeah, that's right.

If he summons Kirin, then it'll be five on two...
I totally forgot.
That's because you leave everything to me.
Hey, that's just division of labor.

(Wh-What the hell...?! I'm fine with being treated
like a side character, but to be completely
brushed aside like this...)

So, you surmised that our target has a companion...
Impressive as ever, Cid.

I'd like for the three of you to tell us everything
you know about Wethermon and Kirin. Then Pencilgon
and I will devise a strategy.
You got it!

...Sure looks like they're having fun stategizing.
And all without a single thought for me!
Boss man!

My only friend is Delta, who wouldn't understand the
meeting anyway... Good girl...
Ehehe! Delta's on your side!

(Not that I'm gonna roll over and take it so easy,
though!)

(They'll never know it, but I'm going with them on
the Wethermon hunt! Count on it!)

6.Text: I wanted to hunt the monster with Boss man...

Delta, this is a good opportunity for us. We need to
do well here so that he'll recognize our abilities,
if even a little.
Alright! Then I'm gonna do my best!

(Even Delta joined them in the end... I knew that was
gonna happen, though.)

(But hey, are these really the same woods where I
found that armored warrior? They feel totally
different somehow...)
The smell is really strong... He's close!
Guess it's about that time. Is everyone ready?
Yes, of course.
If I wasn't, I wouldn't even consider trying this again!
Ahaha, you said it, Katzo!

(Grr... They're even starting throw around this weird
camaraderie!)
...There he is.
So that's Wethermon...
Okay, Alpha, Delta. Shall we do this as planned?
Graaah!!!

Whoa, don't just charge straight in! The real fight
begins once Kirin shows up—
Mmph!
Huh? Is it me, or was that attack super fast?!

It's not just his speed... Something else was off
just now, too.
Right... He didn't say the name of the skill.

Guess there's no hints this time. Definitely
different from the original.

Seems the whole no levels or stats thing also applies
to Wethermon. But instead, he's been made much
stronger...!

Nevertheless, we're lucky you're here. Dodging such a
masterful attack with no prior knowledge could not
have been easy.

Honestly, being able to evade just with what we
told you is quite impressive...

(Hold up, this guy was still as a rock a bit ago.
Why's he suddenly all powered up...?)
(Wait... Could it be that—)

This thing's pretty rusty, but maybe it'd move if I
fed it some magic...

...Hmm, nothing. And here I thought it'd be cool to
have an armor-clad minion tagging along.
(Oh no... It's all because I infused him with magic!)
(This is not good...)
Is that...a horse?
I get why you'd think that.
That's Kirin! Pretty much a dump truck with legs!
So this is the one...! Lady Alpha, let's take it down!

Yes, good memory! Though it feels odd doing so...
we'll leave Kirin up to you two!
Okay, we understand!

Alright... So it's us three versus Wethermon, huh? Why
does it feel like we're doing the heavy lifting?

Hey, not like we have a choice. We could also hold
out until Alpha and Delta finish up on their end and
come join us, too.

Like you said, Sunraku, this is going to be hard.
Let's stay focused!
(Yeah...this is far from ideal.)

(Those three are pretty good, but Wethermon still has
them on the ropes. And it's only gonna get worse as
this fight drags on.)

(You reap what you sow, huh. Which means, time for me
to cut in!)

Okay, he should be moving into the next phase anytime
now...

So you'd think, but his motions aren't changing at
all.

So what's our play? Can't say I'm a fan of keeping up
this dodge fest!

...Travelers of this world. Are you in need of my
power?
Huh? Wh-Who the hell is that?

My name is Shadow... I lurk in the darkness and hunt
down shadows.
Shadow...!
A new enemy, now?!
No, he's an ally. But why is he here...

...The answer is simple. You foresaw we'd have
trouble and came to our aid, yes?

(It hurts having her even look at me! This entire fix
you're in is my fault! Not like I'd ever say that,
though.)

Whatever the reason, I'm glad for any help now! I can
tell you're strong, too!

The let us fight together. Alpha, Delta, stay on the
horse.
Got it!
Of course—and this time we won't need your help!

Shadow, right? The main thing here is to dodge. And
then, when there's an opening, try getting in some
hits, okay?

Yeah, because he's not like when we fought him
before. Think you can handle it?
Heh, of course. Now, follow my lead!

7.Text:
A brilliant maneuver. But in my eyes, it's still much
too...slow!
Whoa... Those are some clean dodges.

He's maintaining perfect distance with minimal
movement... This is no time for being awestruck, but
I can't help it.
...Odd.

This Wethermon is different from the one we know in
terms of both when he summons Kirin and the timing of
his phases. It very well may be that—

The victory conditions are different from then too,
right?

Levels aren't a thing here, so it may be safe to
assume that we don't need to do anything special to
win, either.
Huh. Meaning?
We just hammer him until he drops!
I see. It helps when things are so simple.

We're the ones who'll be in trouble if this drags on
any longer... So, we need to hit him all at once and
end this fast!

So we can finally stop taking it and start dishing it
out! Bashing our way to victory is what we do best!
Time to crash down on him like an angry wave!
Yeah! Just don't fall behind, Shadow!
C'mon, get some! I'm right over...here!
He's distracted! Sunraku, Shadow! Now!!!
Oh yeah, no need—
—To tell us twice!
Haaahhh!!!
*pant pant* How was that?
...Well done.
Truly...splendid...

I know you're not the same Wethermon as before...but
I hope you can rest peacefully again.
...It appears you finished things up here, too.
Oh right, Kirin...is just a big pile of scrap now.
For a horse it didn't look yummy at all.
Looks like you two really know how to throw down.

For us, this was nothing... Alpha, Delta, excellent
work.
Just who the hell are y—
Woah, was that an earthquake?!

...This space is collapsing. It would appear Wethermon
really was the key.

Oh, that means we can finally go home. Whew, I don't
think I could take sleeping in the wild any longer.

Anyway, we owe you all a big thank-you. For helping
us take down Wethermon, too.

Heheh, that was super easy for me! Especially with
Boss ma—
...Huh? Hey, Boss man is gone.

I mean, he never came here with us to begin with,
right?

...True. But I'm sure he will return to where he
belongs. Now then...stay well, you three.
Y-Yeah...hope to see ya around!
Ngh...

My lord! Lady Alpha and Delta as well! I'm so glad
you're unharmed!
Waaaaah!!! I was so worried about you all!

So, you were watching over us. But we're back,
and with Cid in tow.

What a relief... We need to be more careful about how
we handle artifacts from now on.

Looks like these ones broke, though. As dangerous as
they are, it's probably for the best.

I'll take...what's left of the artifacts... I may be
able...to extract some useful data...
Yipe?! I'm never touching one of those again!

Good call... Eta, do take care in your research.
Also, even if you repair the artifacts, you are not
to make others use them.
(Hmm...home sweet home, I guess.)

(I got caught up in a bunch of stuff, but I had fun
and that's good enough for me. Besides—)
This is... Hey, are we home?

Looks like it. Uh-oh, but it looks like our headsets
broke.

I'm cool with that. Not like we're gonna use 'em
again anyway.
Something on your mind, Sunraku?

Not really... But didn't Cid and Shadow seem kinda
similar?
Then there's that "boss" Delta kept talking about—

Ugh, just stop, okay. Yeah, I am kind of curious, but
I'm too tired to think now...

True that... Between roughing it and Wethermon,
I'm beat.

Hmm... Eh, oh well. Guess I'll call it a day and stop
sweating the small stuff.

(That was a jam-packed but not-altogether-bad
experience. Besides—)
(Fighting alongside those guys was really fun!)
